author: @le_parisien
title: 40 % de pluie en plus, température élevée et manque de soleil : la météo d’octobre loin des moyennes en France
text:
40 % de pluie en plus, température élevée et manque de soleil : la météo d’octobre loin des moyennes en France
La quantité de pluie a parfois été remarquable. Malgré cela et le déficit d’ensoleillement, le mois dernier est le neuvième octobre le plus chaud de l’histoire.
Le mois d’octobre n’a pas fait dans la demi-mesure en France d’un point de vue météorologique. Il est marqué par des écarts parfois prononcés avec les moyennes de saison, qu’il s’agisse des précipitations, des températures ou de l’ensoleillement, selon le bilan dressé jeudi par Météo France.
Le chiffre le plus marquant est celui de la pluie. Il est tombé, en moyenne dans tout le pays, 40 % d’eau en plus par rapport à la normale, qui a pour référence la période 1991-2020. Octobre « fait suite à un mois de septembre lui aussi très pluvieux (+ 60 %) ». « Il a été marqué par une succession d’épisodes intenses, entraînant localement d’importantes inondations », rappelle l’organisme météorologique.
Deux fois plus d’eau que la normale dans le Bassin parisien
De nombreux secteurs géographiques ont été particulièrement arrosés. En tête de liste se trouvent l’arrière-pays varois et niçois ainsi que les Cévennes ardéchoises. « La pluviométrie y dépasse de plus de trois fois la normale ». Viennent ensuite le pied des Pyrénées et le Bassin parisien, arrosés deux fois plus que la norme. La pluviométrie « atteint également deux fois la normale du Sud-Ouest au Limousin, du Centre à la Picardie, du sud des Alpes à la Méditerranée et dans les terres des Pyrénées-Orientales ».
Cette carte montre les quantités de pluie tombées en France métropolitaine sur la période. Plus la couleur tourne au vert foncé plus les quantités sont importantes comparativement aux standards. Inversement, plus elle tend vers le marron, moins il a plu. Météo France estime ainsi que la pluviométrie est « plus conforme aux normales sur l’ouest de la Bretagne, le Nord-Est ou encore la moyenne et basse vallée du Rhône ». « Elle est légèrement déficitaire sur les côtes de la Manche, ainsi que sur le littoral du Languedoc et du Roussillon. »
Trois périodes ont été remarquablement pluvieuses au cours des dernières semaines. La première, le 9 octobre, avec le passage des restes de l’ouragan Kirk. Le total de précipitations à ce moment a souvent atteint, voire dépassé, la moyenne mensuelle en une journée seulement. Les sols étant déjà très humides après un mois de septembre pluvieux et les nappes phréatiques étant déjà bien remplies, l’absorption était quasiment impossible et d’importantes inondations ont eu lieu, en Île-de-France notamment.
Mi-octobre, un épisode cévenol record a eu lieu dans le centre-est du pays et en Ardèche. Dans ce département, il n’a jamais autant plu en deux jours. Plusieurs vigilances rouges ont été déclenchées avec, là aussi, de graves inondations. L’épisode cévenol est la déclinaison locale d’un phénomène plus global qu’est l’épisode méditerranéen. Il s’agit d’une forte, voire très forte, concentration de pluie, sur une zone réduite, en peu de temps, aux abords de la Méditerranée.
Retour de la pluie dans les Pyrénées-Orientales
Enfin, la semaine dernière, entre le 24 et le 27 octobre, un nouvel épisode méditerranéen s’est produit dans le Sud-Est. À Vidauban, dans le Var, il est tombé l’équivalent de 119 litres par mètre carré en une heure seulement dans la nuit du jeudi au vendredi, un cumul jamais-vu sur une si courte durée dans ce département, rapporte Météo France. Cet épisode est lié à la goutte froide qui a provoqué les dramatiques inondations en Espagne. Une goutte froide est une dépression d’altitude isolée au milieu d’une masse d’air plus chaude, ce qui peut provoquer de violentes intempéries.
Ces nombreux épisodes pluvieux parfois dangereux ont néanmoins été accompagnés d’une bonne nouvelle : le retour de la pluie dans les Pyrénées-Orientales. Elle est tombée « en toute fin de mois, notamment dans l’intérieur des terres », note Météo France. « 132 mm ont été mesurés en 24 heures à Perpignan le 28 octobre. Il est ainsi tombé en 24 heures la moitié du cumul de l’année 2023 sur la cité catalane (245 mm) ».
Faible ensoleillement, sauf en Bretagne et sur les côtes normandes
Allant de pair avec les nombreuses perturbations, le soleil a logiquement été souvent absent en octobre en France. Le déficit atteint 20 % par rapport à la normale à l’échelle de l’ensemble du pays.
Il a été « particulièrement timide des Pyrénées aux Pays de la Loire (-20 %) ou encore de l’Alsace aux Alpes et jusqu’à la Corse. La Bretagne et les côtes normandes ont en revanche bénéficié d’un ensoleillement excédentaire de 10 %, localement 20 % sur les Côtes-d’Armor », détaille Météo France.
Cette carte de l’organisme météorologique synthétise la situation. Plus la couleur vire au gris, moins une région a été ensoleillée ; plus elle jaunit, plus le soleil a été présent. « Depuis le début de l’année, seuls les mois de janvier et août ont bénéficié d’un ensoleillement plus généreux que la normale 1991-2020 », souligne par ailleurs Météo France.
Enfin, malgré le déficit d’ensoleillement, les températures ont été largement supérieures à la moyenne. Le début d’octobre a certes été marqué par plusieurs jours sous les normales de saison. Mais cela a été plus que largement contrebalancé par l’excédent le reste du mois, qui termine ainsi + 1,6°C au-dessus des standards. Avec 15,27°C de température moyenne sur l’ensemble de la période, octobre 2024 intègre le top 10 des mois d’octobre les plus chauds depuis que les mesures existent. Il occupe le neuvième rang.
Un élément en particulier a fait remonter la moyenne : les températures minimales. Elles ont été bien plus élevées que d’habitude avec une « anomalie chaude particulièrement marquée sur le centre-est et le sud-est du pays », selon Météo France. « Octobre fait suite à deux mois d’octobre anormalement chauds : + 3,5 °C en octobre 2022, mois d’octobre le plus chaud depuis le début des mesures en 1900, et + 2,7 °C en octobre 2023, deuxième mois d’octobre le plus chaud. »
Ce graphique permet de visualiser au jour le jour l’écart à la moyenne. En bleu apparaissent les jours où la température est sous la normale et en rouge ceux où ils la dépassent. Sans rentrer dans le détail des chiffres le constat est facilement visible : les périodes chaudes sont plus longues et plus prononcées que les périodes plus fraîches. De manière plus globale, cette situation est un des éléments caractéristiques du dérèglement climatique.
À part peut-être une exception en milieu de semaine prochaine, les deux premières semaines de novembre devraient être marquées par un temps stable. Le soleil devrait globalement être présent, malgré la présence régulière de brouillard dans les régions les plus au nord. Il pleuvrait peu, voire pas du tout dans plusieurs régions. Les températures se situeraient plusieurs degrés au-dessus des moyennes.

author: VNExplorer
title: AmaZulu FC reach Nedbank Cup quarter-finals with win over Sekhukhune
text:
junior-dion-celebrates-goal-with-teammate-augustine-mulenga-of-amazulu-fc16
Both teams made strategic changes from their previous matches, with Sekhukhune bringing in Katlego Mkhabela and Elias Mokwana, while AmaZulu introduced Junior Dion and Hendrick Ekstein to their starting line-up.
The match began cautiously, with chances sparse in the early stages. Sekhukhune had a golden opportunity midway through the first half when Chibuike Ohizu found himself with a free header, only to be denied by AmaZulu’s goalkeeper Veli Mothwa.
However, it was AmaZulu who broke the deadlock in the 26th minute, as Junior Dion capitalized on a rebound to slot home from close range, giving his side a crucial 1-0 lead heading into half-time.
AmaZulu emerged from the break with renewed vigour, and they quickly doubled their advantage in the 62nd minute. Victor Letsoalo pounced on a defensive error from Sekhukhune’s goalkeeper, Renaldo Leaner, to score into an empty net, making it 2-0 in favour of the visitors.
Despite Sekhukhune’s late surge, with coach Lehlohonolo Seema making tactical substitutions to inject fresh energy into the midfield, they were unable to find a way past AmaZulu’s resolute defence.
Goalkeeper Veli Mothwa produced a nervy save late in the game to preserve his clean sheet, ensuring AmaZulu’s comfortable progression to the quarter-finals.
With this impressive victory, AmaZulu now set their sights on the next challenge in their quest for Nedbank Cup glory.

author: Da redação
title: Comer mignon e picanha ficou mais barato em 2023, enquanto voos puxam a inflação
text:
Os alimentos ajudaram a segurar a inflação este ano. As carnes ficaram 10% mais baratas em média. Por outro lado, o preço das passagens aéreas acumula alta de quase 50% em 2023, o que puxou a prévia da inflação de dezembro.
O IPCA-15 (índice que mede a inflação) acelerou e subiu 0,4% no mês, acima das previsões. Em um ano, o indicador acumulou alta de 4,72%, abaixo do teto da meta de inflação para 2023 (4,75%).
Neste mês, o principal impacto veio do grupo de transportes, com as passagens aéreas 9% mais caras. Desde janeiro, os bilhetes subiram quase 50%, em média. Se viajar ficou mais caro, ficar em casa e fazer um churrasco ficou mais barato.
Foi no balcão do açougue que o brasileiro sentiu o impacto positivo. O preço do cupim, por exemplo, caiu em média mais de 5%. O contrafilé registrou uma baixa superior a 8%. A picanha teve queda média de 9,5%. Abaixo, veja mais dados:
- cupim: -5,16%
- contrafilé: -8,38%.
- picanha: -9,49%
- alcatra: -9,93%
- costela na brasa: -12,41%
- filé-mignon: -12,13%
Neste final de ano, o aposentado Alberto Borges desistiu de viajar. Para ele, sairá mais barato passar o fim do ano em casa. A carne está garantida. A peça-chave para a virada? Patinho porque tem menos gordura.

author: @Masrawy
title: صراخ وبكاء بسبب صعوبة الفيزياء في جنوب سيناء | مصراوى
text:
جنوب سيناء – رضا السيد:
شهد محيط لجان امتحانات الثانوية العامة بمدينة الطور، بمحافظة جنوب سيناء، حالة من التوتر والانهيار بين عدد من طلاب الشعبة العلمية "علمي علوم"، عقب أداء امتحان مادة الفيزياء صباح اليوم الخميس، حيث خرج بعض الطلاب في حالة بكاء شديد، بسبب ما وصفوه بصعوبة الأسئلة وعدم تناسبها مع الوقت المخصص.
وأعرب الطلاب عن استيائهم، مؤكدين أن أكثر من نصف أسئلة الامتحان جاءت غير مباشرة وتحتاج إلى تفكير عميق، بينما الوقت لم يكن كافيًا للإجابة عن جميعها، ما زاد من شعورهم بالضغط والإحباط.
في المقابل، أكد طلاب الشعبة الأدبية أن امتحان مادة التاريخ جاء من داخل المقرر الدراسي، وتميز بالوضوح، إلا أنه كان طويلًا ويحتاج إلى وقت إضافي للتعامل مع كثافة الأسئلة.
وقد أدى طلاب الشعبتين العلمية والأدبية امتحانات اليوم في مادتي الفيزياء والتاريخ، في الفترة من الساعة التاسعة صباحًا حتى الثانية عشرة ظهرًا، بمدة إجابة بلغت ثلاث ساعات.
من جانبه، ترأس عادل عطا، مدير مديرية التربية والتعليم بجنوب سيناء، غرفة العمليات الرئيسية لمتابعة سير الامتحانات، مؤكدًا وصول أوراق الأسئلة إلى جميع اللجان في المواعيد المحددة، وعدم تلقي أية شكاوى رسمية تتعلق بالورقة الامتحانية.
وشدد وكيل الوزارة على أهمية توفير بيئة امتحانية هادئة، والالتزام بالتعليمات الوزارية المنظمة، محذرًا من محاولات الغش أو الشغب، ومؤكدًا تطبيق الإجراءات القانونية فورًا ضد أي مخالفات داخل اللجان، سواء باستخدام وسائل إلكترونية أو عبر انتحال الصفة.

author: Adrian Rauso
title: Union wants BHP to pay extra super, $7.5k ‘mentor’ bonus, plus $10k ‘retention’ bonus and big salary bump
text: exclusive Union wants BHP to pay extra super, $7.5k ‘mentor’ bonus, plus $10k ‘retention’ bonus and big salary bump The full list of demands imposed on BHP by the Australian Workers Union can be revealed, with excess superannuation and fortnightly ‘mentoring bonuses’ being piled onto yearly $10,000 ‘retention bonuses’ and wage hikes. The AWU is targeting BHP’s massive Mining Area C and South Flank iron ore mining operations in an endeavour to reconquer the mining heartland of WA, buoyed by Federal Labor’s overhaul of industrial relations laws.

author: News Desk
title: Son kills mother in Uganda for converting to Christianity - Global Village space
text:
This month, a deeply distressing incident transpired in Busia, Uganda, bringing to the forefront the pervasive problem of religious persecution in the region. Sawuba Naigaga, a 46-year-old woman, regrettably met her demise due to injuries inflicted by her son, highlighting the difficulties encountered by those who adopt Christianity in a society predominantly adhering to the Muslim faith.
Shocking Turn of Events
After completing a four-year work assignment in Saudi Arabia, 25-year-old Ashirafu Basalirwa returned home to a startling discovery. His mother, Sawuba Naigaga, was found engaged in prayer, invoking the name of Jesus. The subsequent events took a distressing turn, escalating from verbal reproach to physical violence. Expressing disapproval for what he perceived as his mother disgracing the family and the tenets of Allah, Basalirwa forcefully pushed Naigaga against a wall before administering a critical blow to her head with a blunt object.
Read More:
Two Christians hospitalised after Christian-Muslim dialogue in Uganda
Conversion Dilemma
Sawuba Naigaga, without the knowledge of her family, adopted Christianity in 2022 following a discreet introduction to the teachings of Jesus by a friend. Despite her regular attendance at church, Naigaga opted to maintain secrecy regarding her newfound faith. The tragic turn of events occurred when her son uncovered her devotion to Christ, revealing the delicate predicament faced by Christians in Uganda, where religious conversion can result in serious repercussions.
Navigating the Aftermath
Following the brutal assault, Ashirafu Basalirwa opted to go into hiding, expressing apprehension over potential reprisals in the heightened religious tension prevailing in Uganda. His actions highlight the precarious situation faced by individuals who embrace a faith divergent from the prevailing one within their community.
Persecution in Uganda
The heartbreaking demise of Sawuba Naigaga is not an isolated incident but rather the latest chapter in a disconcerting narrative of documented persecutions against Christians in Uganda. Despite constitutional assurances of religious freedom, instances of violence against religious minorities persist, showcasing the challenges endured by those who opt for a different faith.
Striving for Coexistence
Uganda, with its constitutional commitment to religious freedom, houses a predominantly Christian population. However, the challenges faced by the Muslim minority, constituting about 12 percent of the population, are evident in regions like eastern Uganda, where their presence is concentrated.
Read More:
Two incidents of religious persecution have come to light in Uganda
The tragic tale of Sawuba Naigaga highlights the imperative to address religious intolerance in Uganda urgently. The right to practice one’s faith must be upheld, fostering an environment where individuals can peacefully coexist, irrespective of their religious beliefs. As Uganda grapples with this pressing issue, the aspiration is for a future where diversity in faith is embraced, rendering tragedies like the one befalling Sawuba Naigaga relics of the past.

author: Agenzia Fides
title: AFRICA/SUD SUDAN - P. Luke e il suo accompagnatore vittime delle violenze intercomunitarie - Agenzia Fides
text: Juba (Agenzia Fides) – “La scomparsa di p. Luke Yugue e del suo accompagnatore va inserita nel triste contesto delle violenze intercomunitarie tra Azande e Balanda che sono di nuovo esplose dopo il grave conflitto del 2021” dice all’Agenzia Fides suor Elena Balatti, missionaria comboniana in Sud Sudan, facendo riferimento al giovane sacerdote scomparso con il suo accompagnatore, Michael Gbeko il 27 aprile, a Tombura, nello Stato dell'Equatoria occidentale. “Gli Azande sono il gruppo etnico maggioritario nell’Equatoria Occidentale mentre i Balanda sono un gruppo numericamente consistente sempre nella stessa regione ma che hanno una presenza anche nel vicino Stato del Western Bahr el Ghazal” spiega suor Elena. “Dopo anni di pacifica convivenza, nel 2021 sono emerse tensioni politiche, anche in riferimento alla delimitazione dei confini territoriali tra le due tribù; tensioni che sono sfociate in un conflitto sanguinoso, con lo sfollamento di migliaia di persone. Il conflitto si è in seguito calmato ma non è del tutto sedato, e da febbraio/marzo di quest’anno, le Nazioni Unite avevano notato un riacuirsi delle tensioni che hanno provocato, purtroppo, l’uccisione di alcune persone, nuovi sfollamenti e nuove violenze, che sono state contenute in parte dai militari” riferisce la missionaria. “La scomparsa di p. Luke si inserisce quindi in questo contesto di odio e violenza” asserisce suor Elena. “P. Luke di etnia Azande, è scomparso il 27 aprile in una zona a prevalenza etnica Balanda, dove svolgeva il suo ministero. Fin dall’inizio c’erano state illazioni sull’uccisione del sacerdote e del suo autista. Però Mons. Edward Hiiboro Kussala, Vescovo di Tombura-Yambio, aveva chiesto ai fedeli di pregare incessantemente per il ritorno dei due, e a quanto pare, ora che il Vescovo ha annunciato una preghiera funebre per entrambi (vedi Fides 23/5/2024), probabilmente ha avuto la conferma di quello che già avevano riportato alcuni media locali, che si è trattato di un duplice omicidio” dice la missionaria. Suor Elena conclude chiedendo “di pregare perché questo conflitto interetnico, che viene strumentalizzato dai politici, (in Sud Sudan siamo in un periodo preelettorale), non si rinnovi con le proporzioni delle violenza del 2021”. (L.M.) author: Kaseya
title: Kaseya’s 2023 Highlights and the Road Ahead
text: Kaseya’s 2023 Highlights and the Road Ahead Woohoo! What an exciting year 2023 turned out to be. Right from upgrading to VSA 10 to unlocking the efficiencies between the Kaseya and Datto solutions and making the strategic acquisition of Vonahi Security, Kaseya has delivered tons of amazing benefits to its customers in 2023. As we stand on the cusp of 2024, we’d like to take a moment to celebrate the milestones and victories that marked our journey. Join us as we take stock of all that we have achieved and give you a glimpse into what lies ahead. VSA 10 upgrade The VSA 10 upgrade was one of the biggest wins of the year. Even though VSA 9 was powerful without comparison, harnessing its complete potential was no mean feat. The following are the key upgrades that distinguish and differentiate [VSA 10](https://www.kaseya.com/get-started/vsa-demo/) from its predecessor: Cutting-edge automation Powered by cutting-edge automation, VSA 10 saves users hundreds and thousands of hours of manual work while also making managing complex tasks seem like a breeze. This gives users the freedom to focus on more creative tasks while the mundane work is handled automatically. We received reports of higher productivity, more efficiency and better work-life balance by our hard-working technicians. Scripting flexibility Another notable change that makes VSA 10 more intuitive is the swapping of the proprietary scripting language of VSA 9’s Agent Procedures for industry-standard PowerShell, Bash, Batch and VBScript. This upgrade gave users more flexibility and freedom to tailor their scripting processes according to their specific needs and preferences. Access to widely used scripting languages makes it easier to integrate VSA 10 with a wide range of tools and existing networks. Seamless integrations The [Kaseya IT Complete platform](https://www.kaseya.com/) that provides seamless integration with a host of critical IT tools makes VSA even more powerful. This year, we further strengthened the connection between Kaseya and Datto solutions with several crucial integrations. Some of the standout integrations that users love are those with [Datto Networking solutions](https://www.datto.com/products/networking/) and with PSA solutions like [Autotask](https://www.datto.com/products/autotask-psa/), [BMS](https://www.kaseya.com/products/bms/) and Vorex. The integration between VSA and Datto’s networking solutions, which are considered the best in the industry, promises to make discovering, deploying and managing networks effortless and cost-effective for technicians. While SMBs can impress their end users with consistent uptime and exceptional performance, MSPs can deliver high-quality managed networking services in a way that will give them a competitive edge and boost profitability. An advanced policy module for greater efficiency Worth mentioning here is the new advanced policy module in VSA 10 that allows policies to be broken up into containerized objects, making it incredibly easy for managed service providers (MSPs) or IT departments to modify policies to meet the specific needs of their clients and end users. For instance, an MSP can create a policy object that includes all security settings for a client and then create a second policy object for the client’s workstations that includes all network access permissions. Mobile device management We also took note of the demand for [mobile device management (MDM)](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/mobile-device-management-mdm/) capabilities and added that to VSA 10. Whether it’s the organization’s own or employee-owned iPhones, iPads or Android devices, technicians can monitor, manage and secure them easily via the Kaseya console. The addition of MDM fulfills our vision of making VSA 10 a truly unified and remote monitoring and management (RMM) solution. It eliminates the need for users to use different management solutions for each type of device, making the management process seamless. Top-notch security Not just an efficient RMM solution, VSA 10 also doubles up as a formidable security solution. Designed to detect and stop threats like ransomware, and eliminate vulnerabilities through advanced patching capabilities, it provides a secure environment for businesses to operate. VSA 10 also provides real-time monitoring of all systems, ensuring that any potential issues are identified and addressed quickly. Kaseya Help Desk Service The [Kaseya Help Desk Service](https://www.kaseya.com/products/help-desk-services/) is our hottest new service launch of the year. It instantly enables MSPs and IT departments to expand their coverage and deliver best-in-class service delivery without expanding their payroll. Bolstered by 100% in-region staff (Orlando, Florida and Dundalk) and operating round the clock, our help desk service will manage the daily delivery and management of L1 and L2 tickets for customers, ensuring data sovereignty that supports major international compliance standards. This is truly one of the biggest launches in Kaseya’s history, freeing MSPs and IT departments from the clutches of the “have-you-tried-turning-it-off-and-on-again” script, freeing them to drive innovation and optimize services. Vonahi and audIT acquisitions At Kaseya, we relentlessly seek to make IT management easier for our customers. We aim to be the one-stop shop for any solution they need to manage their IT. To this end, we acquired Vonahi Security earlier this year. Vonahi, a pioneer in automated [network penetration testing](https://www.kaseya.com/blog/network-penetration-testing/), brings value to Kaseya’s security suite by expanding its scope and reach to meet a wider set of customer needs. vPenTest, an automated network penetration test platform developed by Vonahi, combines a hacker’s knowledge, methodology, processes and toolsets into a single, deployable SaaS platform. It’s designed in such a way that organizations of all sizes can use it to strengthen their IT environment easily, by performing a penetration test within their environment at any time. The best part — vPenTest provides more value at similar to less costs compared to traditional penetration tests. The company also completed its acquisition and integration of [audIT](https://www.channelfutures.com/mergers-acquisitions/kaseya-wraps-acquisition-of-simplified-sales-tool-audit), a premier and automated SaaS-based sales presentation system, in 2023. The solution allows MSPs to create impressive sales presentations in under 30 minutes that allows them to showcase the value of their work creatively and win the business of more prospects. With audIT, technicians can save a good four to six hours that typically go towards creating a presentation while leaving a better impression on clients. It’s the secret weapon in our MSPs’ arsenal to gain a competitive edge. The IT Complete stack The IT Complete stack has become even more comprehensive and powerful thanks to additional integrations with Datto solutions and acquisitions of Vonahi and audIT. With a continued focus on providing seamless workflows between tools and helping IT professionals and teams do their jobs efficiently, IT Complete continues to be a work in progress, with several more integrations in the pipeline. Closing thoughts While 2023 was a standout year for Kaseya and its customers, get ready to buckle up for an even more electrifying ride in 2024. We will be sharing news that’s set to make waves in the IT industry like never before. No, it’s not another acquisition, partnership or IPO announcement. You’ll have to tune in to [Connect Global 2024](https://www.kaseyaconnect.com/) for the big reveal. It’s an exciting time for Kaseya and its customers. There’s plenty to look back on with pride and even more to look forward to.
